post.body: agreed. stock price has lost 95% of value since he took over. they've posted $70B in losses since 2005. http://is.gd/b1Ut
well, i don't think it's 100% his fault, but i think he's culpable enough that he should lose his job.
i think it would have resulted in congress forcing him to leave if he admitted "this was my fault". might happen anyway tho.
lol, ya that was an awkward sentence. his name is on there = congress saying "so, you're saying YOU'RE at fault?" = no job.
@davefleet i don't think that not having wagoner's name on there was not unintentional.
most amazing part of this is that its not the "watershed" that macleans claims. GM did the SAME THING in 2003: http://is.gd/aHHE
much easier on the weekends. altho i take the train 2 work, so i get 2 read 4 pleasure 4 at least an hr everyday
i agree. i think the bottom line is the bottom line. they'll make money & get more people into the apple brand.
i was thinking that too. does this hint at another new product 4 people 2 move on to in a year or so? no idea.
no doubt that it's def a good move for walmart and AT&T tho!
part of me thinks they don't care since the iphone is a gateway device. but i think they should differentiate. plastic not alum?
damn man, that sucks. real sorry to hear.
good post! but i feel it could have been titled "2 steps....". 1. listen. 2. add value. really, that's all there is it 4 me
sure u've seen it, but congrads on rave reviews 4 ur last aussie doc! http://is.gd/be8P owe u 'minor' edits on china 1.
will the fuzzee ducks blend?
srsly! plus, i just want some off-season action to get me through til spring training!
i've been hearing that Teixeira wants 2 play in Bos & sox want him & it's just sorting out the details at this point.
if u know more brands than people, you need to watch less tv, turn off the computer, and make some more friends ;)
i think people should just not do things IRL that could get them fired, whether or not their boss might c it on facebook l8r!
right but should u say "we'll loan u the $ if u present a new biz plan" or "only if u pay a max that the govt sets"?
but shouldn't the market determine that? how much say (ie loand conditions) should the govt have in running the company?
it's true, altho i'd say perceived talent rules over actual talent a lot....and not just in the NFL

Does GM have a product problem or a structure problem? In 07, GM sold 9.37M cars, lost $38.7B. Toyota sold 9.37M cars, made $17.1B.
